page.title: 03TRANSPORT
page.content:
TRANSPORT IN THE NEWBRIDGE AREA
The trains that run from Glasgow to Edinburgh do not stop at Ratho
Station.The most popular form of travel is car then lorry then bus.The buses run frequently such as the Stirling bus to Glasgow or the Stirling bus to Edinburgh.From the Newbridge roundabout the M8 motorway goes west to Glasgow and the M9 goes north west to Stirling.The numbers of vehicles which use the Newbridge roundabout on a week day is about 75,000 but at a weekend it is about 50,000.Airflight is located at Edinburgh Airport;there are about 600 flights per week,the noise and the paraffin are sometimes annoying to local residents.
